Ubuntu California is a group of volunteers who advocate and promote Ubuntu and Free Software in California. We attend and plan events statewide, contact and work with LUGs and other local groups, and act as the public face of the Ubuntu community in California. The group is open to everybody in the state with an interest in spreading and discussing Ubuntu. 

=== Key Details ===

* '''Date''' - 2011 August 
* '''Team Contact''' - <nowiki>[[lyz|Elizabeth Krumbach]]</nowiki> lyz@ubuntu.com
* '''Leadership Team''' - <nowiki>[[jdeslip|Jack Deslippe]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[DarkwingDuck|David Wonderly]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[lyz|Elizabeth Krumbach]]</nowiki>
* '''Membership''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-california/+members|142]]</nowiki> as of August 14 2011
* '''Launchpad''' - <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-california]]</nowiki>
* '''Mailing List''' - <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-us-ca|ubuntu-us-ca]]</nowiki> on lists.ubuntu.com (230 subscribed as of August 14 2011)
* '''IRC''' - #ubuntu-us-ca on Freenode (<nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Meetings|IRC meetings]]</nowiki> every other Sunday)
* '''Forums''' - <nowiki>[[http://california.ubuntuforums.org/]]</nowiki>
* '''Team Reports''' - <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-TeamReports]]</nowiki>
* '''Bi-Weekly Team Meetings''' - <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Meetings]]</nowiki>
* '''Microblogs''' - <nowiki>[[http://identi.ca/ubuntucalifornia|Identi.ca]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://twitter.com/ubuntu_us_ca|Twitter]]</nowiki> (same data as identi.ca)
* '''Flickr''' - <nowiki>[[http://www.flickr.com/photos/ubuntu-us-ca]]</nowiki>
* '''Other''' - <nowiki>[[https://www.facebook.com/ubuntu.california|Facebook]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://linux.com/community/groups/viewgroup/878-UbuntuUSCA|Linux.com]]</nowiki>

=== Roadmap ===

==== Upcoming Events ====

* Several regular Ubuntu Hours across the state, see LoCo Directory:
** <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/teams/ubuntu-california]]</nowiki>
* August 27, 2011: <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-Picnix20|Picnix 20]]</nowiki>

==== Goals ====

* Seek out more conferences and events where the team can have a booth
* Work with developing QA teams to bring testing to more of our events

** <nowiki>[[http://www.linuxpicnic.org/twiki/bin/view/Picnix19/|Picn*x]]</nowiki> is a picnic held annually in the San Francisco Bay Area, from their site: "This is a celebration of all the accomplishments of Open Source Software since the release of the first Linux kernel in August 1991. Participants and enthusiasts of Open Source software, more than just Linux, are welcome."
** Date: Saturday August 21, 2010
** Time: 11AM - 4PM
** Location: <nowiki>[[http://www.sunnyvale.ca.gov/Departments/CommunityServices/Parks/BaylandsPark.aspx|Sunnyvale Baylands Park]]</nowiki>

==== September 2010: Solano Stroll ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <tablestyle="float:right;"><nowiki>[[File:solano2010.jpg|photo from Solano Stroll]]</nowiki><<BR>>Photo courtesy of Mark Terranova
|}
* <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-SolanoStroll2010|Solano Stroll 2010 Project page]]</nowiki>
* "The Solano Stroll event is a ~ mile long street fair held once a year in Berkeley California on Solano Ave. There are over 500 vendor and non-profit booths. Attendees are ordinary folks from the Berkeley/SF-Bay area who may or may not have a technical background. It is, thus, a good opportunity to advertise Ubuntu to a general audience."
* <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/350/detail/|LoCo Directory Entry]]</nowiki>

==== October 2010: Code Camp 2010 ====
* <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-CodeCamp2010|Code Camp 2010 Project page]]</nowiki>
* "Code Camp was a no-cost (free as in beer) event focused on developers, that happened on October 9th and 10th 2010 at Foothill College, in Los Altos (in the San Jose/So. Bay Area, Silicon Valley)... We put on a 75 minute session of lightning talks around the topic Beginning Ubuntu Gnu/Linux Development on Saturday, 5pm. Follow the above links for more info."
* Visit the project page for links to videos and slides from this event

==== October 2010: East Bay Make Faire ====
* <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-EastBayMakeFaire|East Bay Maker Faire]]</nowiki>
* "Similar to our booth at the Solano Stroll, we are going to be mostly demoing Ubuntu on various hardware and distributing Ubuntu discs, brochures and pamphlets. Additionally, we are located next to the Fixit Clinic - and the organizer is encouraging people to bring in old laptops etc... to try Ubuntu on. If he repairs their computer hardware, we can give them an Ubuntu disc to take home with them."
* <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/events/team/486/detail/|LoCo Directory Entry]]</nowiki>

* <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-Projects-LightingTheMaverickLAMP|Lighting The Maverick LAMP Project page]]</nowiki>

==== June 2010 - Present: Ubuntu Hours ====

<nowiki>[[File:ubuntuhours.png]]</nowiki>

Ubuntu California has been hosting Ubuntu Hours across the state regularly since June of 2010.

Areas which have hosted Ubuntu Hours so far:

* Lake Forest
* San Francisco
* San Diego
* San Jose
* Mountain View
* Santa Cruz
* Palo Alto
* Vallejo
* Los Angeles
* Pasadena
* Roseville

See our <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/teams/ubuntu-california/events/history|Events History]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[CaliforniaTeam-TeamReports|Team Reports]]</nowiki> for details.
